name: browse
description: Perform a one-shot web search and scrape the top result. Use this for quickly answering questions that require current web data without multiple turns.

name: search_web
description: Search the internet for information using Bing Search. Use this to find answers to questions, research topics, or find current events.

name: visit_page
description: Visit a specific URL and extract its text content. Use this to read articles, documentation, or other web pages found via search.

name: click_element
description: Click on a specific element or text on the current page. Moves the cursor naturally and performs a click.

selector.description: The text content or CSS selector of the element to click.

name: type_in_input
description: Type text into a specific input or textarea on the current page. Moves the cursor, clicks, and then types.

selector.description: The CSS selector or index (number) of the input to type into.

name: scroll_page
description: Scroll the current page up or down.

amount.description: The amount to scroll in pixels (default: 500).

name: take_screenshot
description: Capture a screenshot of the current browser page. Use this to observe the visual state of the page.

name: analyze_page
description: Navigate to a URL and perform a visual analysis of the page content. Returns a summary of what's visible. Use this ONLY when text-based extraction (visit_page) is insufficient or when you need a high-level visual overview.

url.description: The URL to visit and analyze.

goal.description: What information you're looking for on this page.

name: use_vision
description: Use visual analysis to determine the next action on the current page. Use this ONLY when DOM-based tools (click_element, type_in_input) fail, when you are visually stuck, or when interacting with canvas/complex UIs. Prefer visit_page for information gathering.

goal.description: What you're trying to achieve on this page.

name: check_current_page
description: Perform a fresh observation of the current page state. Returns rich metadata about inputs, buttons, and content. Use this to verify you are on the right page before navigating or searching.

name: execute_js
description: Execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the browser context. Use this for complex DOM interactions, multi-step form filling, or when existing tools fail. You have access to the full DOM API (document.querySelector, etc.). Must return a value if you want to see the result.

name: run_command
description: Execute a shell command on the user's computer. Use this to run scripts, install packages, or perform system administration tasks. BE CAREFUL with destructive commands.

name: read_file
description: Read the contents of a file from the local file system.

path.description: The absolute path to the file.

name: write_file
description: Write content to a file. Can be used to create new files or overwrite existing ones.

path.description: The absolute path to the file.

name: move_file
description: Move or rename a file from a source path to a destination path.

source.description: The current absolute path of the file.

destination.description: The new absolute path for the file.

name: copy_file
description: Copy a file from a source path to a destination path.

source.description: The absolute path of the source file.

destination.description: The absolute path for the destination file.

name: delete_file
description: Delete a file from the local file system. USE WITH EXTREME CAUTION.

path.description: The absolute path of the file to delete.

name: make_directory
description: Create a new directory at the specified path.

path.description: The absolute path of the directory to create.

name: list_directory
description: List the files and subdirectories within a given directory.

path.description: The absolute path to the directory.

name: get_system_info
description: Retrieve information about the system (OS, memory, CPU, etc.).

name: open_app
description: Launch a desktop application by name.

app_name.description: The name of the application to open.

name: close_app
description: Close a running application by name.

app_name.description: The name of the application to close.

name: get_clipboard_content
description: Read the current content of the system clipboard.

name: set_clipboard_content
description: Set the content of the system clipboard.

content.description: The text to copy to the clipboard.

name: set_volume
description: Set the system volume level.

name: get_battery_status
description: Get the current battery level and charging status.

name: send_notification
description: Display a desktop notification.

name: get_current_time
description: Get the current local date and time.

name: calculate
description: Perform a mathematical calculation.

name: manage_calendar
description: Manage calendar events (add, list, delete).

details.description: JSON string containing event details (title, time) or query parameters.

name: remember_fact
description: Save a fact or user preference to long-term memory. Use this when the user shares something important you should remember (e.g., 'My name is Alice', 'I use Python', 'My API key is...').

description.description: Short context or description of what this memory is about.

name: search_memory
description: Search long-term memory for specific information. Use this BEFORE answering questions that might depend on past context.

name: list_memories
description: List all saved memories, optionally filtered by category.
